comment.text:
We visited Cafe Agora on a Tuesday night.
Self parking was tricky, but we were able to get a parking space right away.
We were seated immediately and our server brought us soft drinks promptly.
We ordered the Turkish Mousaka and the Gyro Sampler Platter both with salads.
The food came to our table as soon as it was ready.  We enjoyed the Mediterranean style salads, and savored every bite of our meals.  Turkish Mousaka does not use potatoes so it had a lighter body and texture.  It was delicious.  
we enjoyed the decor as well.  the walls have murals of windows looking into Turkish landscapes.
We will return soon.

I don't leave many reviews but I must say that after going here I had to leave one.
The food was delicious. My date and I both ordered the Adana kebab and we both loved it.
The ambiance and the free parking were both reasons why I selected this Cafe Agora in the first place. The mood and the lighting was just right and just. And of course free parking is what I'm all about.
The service was great. Friendly, not bothersome and attentive.
Finally the food. The food was delicious. Both my date and I ordered the Adana kebab. She also had a glass of pinot and I had a beer. As I stated before the food was delicious.
Cafe Agora is my new go to spot whenever I'm in Buckhead.

Cafe Agora near buckhead village has been consistently serving up wonderful middle eastern food. Their kebabs are to die for! The service is amazing too and not too heavy on your pockets!
We went with some friends on thanksgiving weekend and still found the food and service both to be really good. Note: food portions are big! Order accordingly.

People jumped on the food before I could get my camera out - so pics reflect that!!

photos.caption: Chicken Gyro Platter Chicken Gyro Platter

comment.text: we order Uber eats from here a lot. I would say their food qualities is fairly consistent along with their flavors. Their lamb gyro is delicious. Their carrot salad and their baba ghanoush for appetizers is yummy. There's plenty full pita bread. We also got their mixed plate and their rice is amazing with pineapple, chicken and lamb and other meats. In the past I've also gotten the coconut cake and the tiramisu and it was delicious. Their food quality is consistent although I've never been inside the restaurant itself.it's delivered quickly. We often get food from here and we love it.

Two snaps for a solid  casual meditteranean choice in Buckhead.

Seated promptly for Friday lunch! The lentil soup wss heart warming. Delicious flavor.

The hummus was very smooth.

I had the falafel and devoured it. no pic. sorry.

My friends had the mix plate and loved as well.

Service was on point, considering it was one server for the whole place. He made sure to check on us regularly.

Whenever I am near Buckhead, there's only one restaurant I think about going: Cafe Agora. I trust the authenticity of the food from here. And always looking forward to the rice puddling they give at the end. I post a lot of Asian food and rarely Mediterranean, so I look forward to learn & share more in the future. 

Dolma has a pleasant fresh tarte taste, it's soft and filling (since it's stuffed with rice). First time having grape leaves and everything works together very well. I recommend at least trying this at least once. 

Hummus ain't strong in flavor like the ones you get at the store (which can be overly salted). The flavor hits in the after taste. Light in color so you know it's fresh.

Sigara Boregi Beef - imagine crispy spring rolls that's savory and packed with beef whenever you take a bite, then you will like this. Wish this came in fours so we don't have to split the last one.

Chicken Shish Kebab is a classic dish. I'm a lamb lover but chicken was tasty too. I always enjoy the fresh greens they serve with it.

Lamb Shank (dinner menu) - I crave this dish but I can't get it alone. The lamb is soft & perfectly cooked off the bone. The tomato sauce is delicious but the tartness can be overwhelming. The only veggies are roasted tomato and green bell pepper. This is why I need the salad from my partner's plate. It makes the dish balanced.

Doner Kebab Plate - not my dish but the fries were fantastic. 

Pistachio Baklava - The first time I was served Baklava, it was the size of a brick. When I saw their portion, I was disappointed by the contrast. But learning how sweet this dessert was, it's meant to be a one-biter. This pastry is very sweet & sticky but I enjoy the crispiness on the top.

Sutlac (Turkish Rice Pudding) - They serve a small cup of this when you checkout which is the perfect ending to any meal. I always debate if I should get one togo. 

Follow me on socials for more foodie finds @yvon_ow

Start to finish 5 stars! 

Stopped in for lunch and the first thing you notice is the ambiance and decor. It feels Mediterranean and light inside with comfortable seating. 

There was only one person working when we went and he was HUSTLING! He did not miss a beat, fast service, quick refills on water. Really fantastic. 

The food was delicious! It tasted light and fresh. I had the mixed gyro plate and my husband had the chicken gyro. He literally wiped the plate clean! The portions are good size and I had basically a second meal out of my entree. 

Will definitely be back to enjoy this lovely spot!

Good Greek food in a nice atmosphere.  We love their hummus and warm pita for a starter, and their Greek lemon chicken soup will cure what ails you!

My husband loves their lamb gyros but they have plenty of other items to choose from.  The lamb is truly delicious . . . Flavorful, tender, and juicy.  The pita bread is fluffy, soft, and warm.

Such a fun place for lunch or dinner!

Food was okay nothing great about it! The potatoes were taste like old grease. server lied about the bar being closed . We were treated poorly because we are minority. I would not come here again. You can get better service at a fast food restaurant. Ezgi was the name of the server . I hope that they can fix her attires they Passed out ice cream to everyone but us

photos.caption: Turkish Potatoes Chicken Shish Kebab Mixed Gyro Platter

comment.text: All good things must come to an end. It's Just not what it used to be back in the day.  Pita bread is doughy, lamb flavorless and meze was lackluster. They price it with pride, but doesn't seem to be made with pride.  My last time

When got there we got seated right away and we asked to sit outside and they were very nice about it. It's in downtown buckhead, but it's away from the busy streets, so it was nice and quiet. First we got the sigara rolls. They remind you of a taqueria but light and airy. We got ground beef inside and it was flavored really well with parsley, dill and herbs. Paired great with the homemade titzki. Overall those were 10/10. Actually, they were so good, we got a second order. They come with 3 per order. 

Vinny was our waiter and he was so nice and patient. One of us got lamb chops, and it came with 4 handsome pieces. They weren't too gamy and they were cooked perfectly. A perfect medium! Came with a salad and a bed of rice that was moist and beautifully flavored. 

Then we got a platter of falafel. It came with 4 big falafels, 4 pieces of pita, Greek salad with balsamic dressing, and hummus. It was all great! 

Then they gave us both little cups of rice pudding. It was a sweet little complimentary dessert, a pleasant surprise! 

Can't wait to go back!
Food was outstanding.  The Kafta was well flavored and the chicken kabob was delicious. Service was good. Highly recommend.

Great find. Food was very good and service was fair. Our order was taken promptly and food was served hot. However we were swimming in dishes at the table. The server never cleared one' plate during the entire evening.

My husband and I had lunch here today. The food was delicious and the service was great. I loved my gyros chicken plate, the flavor was amazing and my husband mixed grill salad looked tasty, he finished the whole plate and loved every bite.  The ambiance was cozy.

Decent Turkish cuisine.  But, nothing really outstanding.  In other words, it was just average. The best item was their mezze appetizer featuring various dips and spreads.  I think most people would like that one (see picture).  

The entree options were kind of limited.  Mostly gyros or skewers.  Other than that, there's 2 fish entrees and mousaka.  I had the chicken and the flavor was fine.  But, I've had similar at the ubiquitous Greek quick service places.  

Other than the food being average, I was also annoyed by how they dealt with my kids orders.  My daughter ordered off the kids menu.  My son (11 years old) asked for the salmon.  I interrupted him while ordering and said that he needed to select the kids meal options (which didn't include salmon -- which was a $23 item).  He ordered the same thing as my daughter.  So, when the food came out, the waiter brought a kids size for my daughter and an adult entree for my son!  This was done despite him hearing me correct him and order the kids entree!  

Overall:  A pass.  Not really worth it.  It's average.

I tried a few different appetizers. It was a little disaster. Two items were replaced with two different ones. I wonder if the restaurant was out of the dolma and eggplant or if the waiter was tripping.
The other two items, the potato, and spanakopita were microwaved.  I hate getting leftovers in restaurants.  

I won't be back. Now I have to find a GOOD Mediterranean restaurant in Buckhead.

Food: overpriced - $19 for 5 cubes of chicken. Bland food. 
Service: Waiter was on phone the entire time and disengaged, 1 waiter for all tables at dinner. 
Ambiance: decorated like a small family restaurant.

I had the spanakopita for an appetizer. Only came in four squares but was very tasty. Had the Lamb gyro plate. Meat was great and the portion was plenty. With salad rice and pita you won't leave hungry.
Cafe agora is consistently delicious and service is always quick and friendly. You really can't go wrong from the gyro to any of the plates. The little free desert at the end is a nice touch.

We went here for my Friend's birthday two days ago around 1pm. My friend reserved a table for 14 people inside and was hoping to have a great time overall. However, a few unfortunate incidents took place that I thought of sharing. 

The very First thing that went Wrong: 
The host was walking towards the door of the restaurant from the patio and we were right behind him. He clearly saw us so I thought he would hold the door but it slammed right on our faces which shows he did not bother. 

Second incident: 
No greetings at all or asking how we are. He just asked if we had a reservation and I said yes, the rest of the party is already seated so should I just go look for them or do you know where they are seated? His response: There are too many people in there but go ahead see if you can find your friends. I did not like his tone at all.

Third incident: 
We are sitting for almost 30 mins, no one showed up and asked if we wanted anything to drink or wanted any appetizers. Finally, he came and with an attitude took everyone's orders- wasn't interested in explaining the menu or anything.

Fourth incident: 
Two of our friends needed to leave early so they asked if they could get their check, our server says: No there is only one check so I cannot separate it now. My friend said, well but we were all gonna pay separately, is there any way you could try that? The server said: No it is not possible for me to make separate checks since you didnt tell me during ordering. So don't you think he should have asked us if it will be one check or separate? Because all the restaurants ask about it before they bring you the check. How are we supposed to know to let him know before we ordered the food? So I requested and said: I am sorry we cannot pay all together, we would have told you if you asked but we would really appreciate if you try to separate it. His response: OH MY GOD! and he leaves. 

Fifth incident: 
When we were done eating, we wanted to cut the cake so we asked if they could clear the table a bit but no one bothered to do that, instead he asked us to walk up to the register and pay before leaving. 

How is this professional at all in a restaurant like Cafe Agora? It is a nice elegant restaurant so we expect to receive the check and not walk up and pay like we do in fast foods because I am paying extra money for the service too. 

Well, the food was great and I would love to go just for the Adana Kabob or even the mixed grill platter, however, the service is really poor and that makes me not want to go ever again. Our server was Daniel, I hope he understands that these kinds of behavior can really ruin someone's birthday lunch and it is not professional at all.

Cafe Agora in Midtown Atlanta has been our go-to place for a quick and excellent Greek meal. 

My favorite item on the menu is the Lamb Gyro. The juicy lamb is well-seasoned and served with a zesty tzatziki sauce over warm fluffy pita bread. The portion size is considerable, making it a filling alternative for anyone with a ravenous appetite.

My wife usually orders the Lamb Gyro Platter, which she adores. It features all of the famous Lamb Gyro flavor as well as a side of fluffy rice, a Greek salad, and warm pita bread. The plate provides a well-balanced dinner.

We usually always order Fried Eggplant to go with our gyros. It's a delicious appetizer that's difficult to pass up.

While we prefer to order our food to go, we've had the opportunity to dine in on a few occasions, and the environment at Cafe Agora is welcoming. The staff is polite and helpful, making every visit enjoyable.

Cafe Agora is a definite must-visit if you're in the Midtown Atlanta neighborhood and seeking great Mediterranean cuisine. Whether you like their Lamb Gyro or their Lamb Gyro Platter. Cafe Agora is one of our favorite restaurants to visit because of its pleasant service and consistently wonderful food.
The food and service was excellent. I would definitely recommend going there! They need another location perhaps in Marietta.

The service tonight was terrible. They gave our food to another table . Took it back then the table of about 20 people got their food before us. Our server was not attentive. The manager was rude and after we paid were told not to come back . They must be under new management cause the first I went the service was great. Food is good but don't always count on the service to be the best.

Everything here is delicious and Al, the owner, is an absolute hoot!  Start with the meze platter and don't use too much of the bread or you'll get full and won't be able to eat the other food!  The Adana kebab is my favorite because it's a little spicy but don't sleep on the gyros either.  Everyone we've ever had there has been exceptional and if you like to order take out or delivery everything aside from the fries travels well
Delicious and plentiful, lots of healthy options . Suitable to many dietary needs. I love the flavors.

My son says the lamb in the gyro was excellent.  I had the falafel sandwich and I was hoping to get a bit more flavor and the pita bread was a bit dry however; the Taramisu made up for it all!  My son had the chocolate cake as well and he said it was moist and quite delicious.
Adana kebab was delicious.  Comes with rice, pita and salad.  The hummus was very good and service was excellent.  I would come back.

Staff was nice but I Will not order from here again. Place an Togo order for a gyro platter. The rice was not balsamic. It was regular white rice, overcooked, no flavor and mushy. I looked up Mediterranean places and went there, expecting which I usually get from Mediterranean restaurant and this was not it. It was like rushed street food gyro just in a Togo box and not wrapped.
The food was amazing quick service the whole atmosphere was just a vibe definitely coming back 10/10

Cafe Agora seems to be a favorite on Yelp, so I decided it was time for me to experience it myself. I was a little hesitant when I pulled in to park because the place looked empty. I chose to sit outside and there was one other family outside dining. However, after sitting for about five minutes, I quickly realized that Cafe Agora stays busy with takeout orders. I kid you not, during the 40 minutes or so I was there, I counted at least 30 people come in to pick up their takeout orders. Now for the food, I ordered:

1. Turkish Potatoes ($8) - Quite tasty! I'd order these again.

2. Mix Gyro Plate ($15) - Chicken & Lamb. Also served with rice, salad, pita bread and tsazitki  sauce. The lamb was amazing! The chicken was flavorful as well, but the lamb stole the show here.

3. Chicken Shish Kebab ($17) - Also very tasty and served with rice, salad, pita bread and tsaziki sauce. 

The serving portions are huge! Was definitely too full to order dessert. However, the owner brought out samples of their rice pudding with a little cinnamon sprinkled on top. It was good! Overall, I had an enjoyable time at Cafe Agora!
The food was really good and the vibe seemed very authentic. The baklava was really good but small so I wouldn't recommend sharing a dessert.

On a Sunday me and my family were visiting , and nobody came to our table to take our order . We were so excited , to eat at this place , but the attitude of the one server was really nasty. Nobody asked if we wanted anything to drink or nothing . So my family and i left . Once we told the waiter that we were leaving due to the lack of service , he acted as if he did not care at the fact that we were leaving . There were other families who came in behind us, and were served water while we had nothing .

I sat on the patio and enjoyed a nice evening ambiance with a nice view of E Paces Ferry. I ordered the chicken shish kabob plate which came with pita bread, salad, and rice. Everything was excellent. The chicken was well seasoned. The dressing on the salad was tasty. And the food was hot and fresh! kudos to the servers who were very pleasant and accommodating!

Family owned, this place just hits the spot. 

Hungry and bit worn from the day, I didn't get the chance to document the food...But know that this place is in need of you stopping by. 

We had the beef sigara rolls to start, and they were extremely tasty. Flaky dough wrapping nicely seasoned beef, a must try. Speaking of must tries -- the agora mixed platter. This place seasons their meats extremely well, something that honestly isn't as common as you'd hope. 

I could harp on & on about how happy we were to run into Cafe Agora when we did, but I'll save it for next time. 
I'll be back
Some of the best Mediterranean food I have ever eaten. Giant portions and unbeatable service! Highly recommend the mixed gyro plate, tue lamb is out of this world good.

It's been a long time since I have been at café agora but they are still great! 
This location is probably a lil nicer than the other one in Midtown in regards to ambiance and decor. Even though I haven't been in the one in Midtown in a while, and they may have changed.
The food here is pretty consistent and tasty. The lentil soup is very different than others as it's probably all blended and you don't have the texture of the lentils but it is VERY tasty!
Whenever I visit Buckhead I think to go here. Fresh med food. Best into town at a reasonable price. Agora Mixed Grill

Since my last review in 2017, this place still doesn't disappointment! 

My party of 3 left satisfied and did outside patio dining.  Waiters were attentive and the food was good.

photos.caption: Chicken and lamb gyro was good.
Salmon platter was so good and fresh
Salad... the dressing is simply delicious

comment.text:
Was in the mood for Mediterranean food and have heard great things about Cafe Agora and it didn't disappoint! 
Visited for a quiet Sunday lunch. It was a beautiful sunny day and the outdoor patio only added to the experience. The food is simple but tasty and reasonably priced. The service was quick, pleasant, and fully masked. 
Be ware of the parking. It is limited. 

Overall, great experience and I'll definitely be back and would recommend for others to stop by!

We were in this area a bit before noon on a Sunday, primarily to visit the Christkindl holiday market thing in Buckhead Village. After an initial stroll through there, nothing really drew me in food-wise. We had walked by Café Agora on the way there; it was only 2 doors (or empty lots) down the street, so we opted to have lunch there. 

I've seen this place for a while. I have not visited Buckhead with anything approaching frequency for a long time, so I'm not sure exactly how long this place has been here; their website didn't say. It feels like it has been there for a while, though. They appeared to have their own (small) parking lot. There is parking available nearby in decks and on-street (both for a fee).

They appeared to have limited patio seating, but the weather was cold with some light drizzle, so no one was going for that. They have a large interior dining room and appeared to have some bar seating as well (though it was closed off at the time). 

The menu had a surprising array of choices given that it was basically just one page. In addition to a few sorts of gyros, they also had fish, at least a couple of types of kabobs, a decent selection of appetizers, etc. We both went for the gyro, which also included a small salad. 

The portion size wasn't overwhelming, but neither was it skimpy.  I didn't particularly want leftovers but I was able to finish my plate without feeling overly full. The gyro itself was very flavorful.  Both of us enjoyed our salads; they were small, but with a large variety of vegetables. 

Prices were not outrageous despite their location in Buckhead.

I was expecting a rather average dining experience here, but was quite pleasantly surprised. I will definitely keep this place in mind should I be in Buckhead again at meal-time.

Had a delicious lunch that started with calamari and maze platter. I had spanakopita for my meal, my daughter had mix gyro platter and her partner had lamb gyro platter. Everything was mouthwatering! The service was top notch as always. I love the fine dining feel with the white table cloths and napkins yet casualness of the lunchtime crowd.

The rice pudding was to die for! The food was delicious. We had the chicken plates and it captured all the right flavors and texture I like. Great dining experience. Lighting was subtle. The privacy felt secluded. Overall an enjoyable date night. I recommend if you're in Atlanta looking for Mediterranean food.  - E+D
This is one of my go to places in Buckhead. Love it. Chicken kebab platter and gyro are my go to dishes. Wish the chicken kebab portions were more consistent but great other than that.

Best Mediterranean Food in Atlanta. Great for dine in and takeout. Friendly staff and always fresh delicious food. Bring your family here or go on a date. Cafe agora tends to all and is one of my favorite restaurants in Atlanta.

My family and I are Turkish so we decided to stop by Cafe Agora for the first time since we were all craving some fresh Turkish food, and I have to say this is best Turkish food I have ever had since I have been back from Turkey. Not the mention the service is amazing as well. The ambience is relaxing with indoor and outdoor seating. The restaurant is also in walking distance from downtown Buckhead. I highly recommend coming to Cafe Agora, you will not regret it!
Theree is not exactly turkish restaurant . When i go theree i saw irrelevant employees ad uncooked unsavory and expencive prices.

This is the best Greek food I've ever had in Atlanta and I've been to a few, omg the tzatziki sauce was the best, so delicious I had to get extra! I got the lamb gyro plate , it was so yummy and a lot good for the price. I had to write a review that's how good the food was
Delicious! The place is casual yet comfortable. Hummus for an appetizer and chicken shish kebab for entree. We will be back!

Grabbed a bite here since it was walking distance from the Atlanta History Center. It was around 4:30p & not many people there, but few more people showed up around 5p. We took our time ordering & did ask for recommendations or specials, but the Waiter didn't have any to give. Food came out pretty quickly from the time we ordered. Everything was tasty & portions were a nice size. We asked for lemon for our water, but it never came. We didn't get checked on or have our water refilled. It was as if they forgot about us. Overall the food is good but three stars for the lack of attentiveness, especially when it wasn't busy. I'd come again in case this was a one-off. Also a Waiter should be able to recommend dishes, even if it's to mention their favorite.
Absolutely love this place. The food is incredible and so are the DESSERTS! Reasonable prices, quick service, and kind staff!
